comment.author: 13267298@N00
39165494@N06
comment._content: Various clues may suggest photo dates to c1912-13.There appears to be a date on White's new fascade,perhaps 1912?The multiple tram lines and tram wires suggest the Spit-to-Manly tram route had been opened (1911).Also,the corner of Whistler St. and The Corso was redeveloped c 1913-14 for Castle Vernon Flats,in full brick,with new shops on the ground floor.These flats are not shown,and the earlier w.b. shops are shown in the photo.Purves Bakery(and cafe)in the photo was built in 1898 and still stands today,with its dated late Victorian parapet, beside Castle Vernon Flats.Do the Chinese lanterns hanging from the shopfronts suggest a festival...perhaps an early Manly Venetian Carnival?
